channel.title: Looking to buy a laptop
channel.description:
Basically I'm looking for a laptop that I can use for everything, which in my case is college, photoshop/illustrator, gaming, and of course general browsing of the net(although I'll save most gaming for my desktop). I've never had a laptop for over a month or so without returning it, but with the classes I'm taking next semester I'm going to need one permanently. I really don't know what to look for spec wise.
Tldr; what's a good price for a good laptop with good(better than average) specs?

item.title: Looking to buy a laptop
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

[quote=“eczema3, post:13, topic:390797”][quote author=abraham2119 link=topic=486738.msg3568806#msg3568806 date=1302885512]

[quote author=cumescape link=topic=486738.msg3568553#msg3568553 date=1302857016]

No it won’t.

The IBM thinkpads are so old now, it wouldn’t be worth the effort finding one.
[/quote]What do people do with laptops? Check their emails, do some coding in emacs or nano, IRC, nothing the IBM ThinkPad can’t handle.
[/quote]who the fuck uses programs in nano

uses programs in nano? wat[/quote]wow what the fuck…that was supposed to be ‘who the fuck programs in nano’

Read full topic

item.title: Looking to buy a laptop
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I know you think that you want a gaming laptop, I used to think I wanted one too, but basically without exception, you will be disappointed. If you want a laptop, get a laptop. If you want to game, build an entry-level gaming desktop for much cheaper and I think you will be much happier.

Read full topic

item.title: Looking to buy a laptop
item.dc:creator: @cumescape cumescape
item.description:
@cumescape wrote:

[quote=“chrisn2323, post:5, topic:390797”]IBM stopped making those a few years ago so unless you want a dated laptop don’t do this.[/quote]It will still last a decade… There is no reason for a SPEEDY GAMING laptop. The ThinkPad will do all and more that what you need for the go.

Read full topic

item.title: Looking to buy a laptop
item.dc:creator: @chrisn2323 chrisn2323
item.description:
@chrisn2323 wrote:

I have an hp envy 14 and its pretty good for college. It had a 14" screen so its very portable, but its got a good gfx card with switchable gfx for battery life and its pretty powerful.

cumescape:

IBM Thinkpad, be sure to get the IBM branded one not the Lenovo.

IBM stopped making those a few years ago so unless you want a dated laptop don’t do this.

Read full topic

item.title: Looking to buy a laptop
item.dc:creator: @Thebeanie TheBeanie
item.description:
@Thebeanie wrote:

My mate managed to get Dell xps 17 (i think)…

He got a good deal i think.

Intel I7 3.1ghz (i think… it was above 3ghz)
Nvidia Geforce 550GT with 3gb of memory 3d
6gb of ram.
640gb HD

For £900…

Cant find the same deal tho… ill have to ask him Update soon.

Read full topic
